answers.answer: did you try posting in the monitored heart forum.  From what I know with my dad when an artery is only partially blocked they prescirbe medicince.  I believe if I remember correctly about my dad they told him an artery has to be 100% blocked before any type of surgery is done.

question: I was recently diagnosed with 60-79% blockage in my carotid arteries.  I am 39 yr old female, am not overweight, have normal blood pressure, normal cholesterol (but the HDL is a little low at 44), do not have diabetes, exercise regularly and try to eat healthy.  Needless to say, I am in complete shock.The dr. is treating me with aspirin and lipitor and sending me to vascular specialist for monitoring.  Is this the typical treatment for this condition?  At what point do I have ot worry about surgery?Is there any way that my severe migraines could be related to the lack of blood flow to the brain from the blockages?  Would another test be able to provide more details on this?  I am concerned about having a stroke at a young age and not being able to care for my children who are now 3 and 5 yrs old.
title: Carotid Artery blockage at 60-79% in 39 yr old female
